title: Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Every Aspect of Life - Building AI Future: Aligning Skills for a Viksit Bharat
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly redefining the way we live, work, and interact. No longer confined to the realm of science fiction, AI is now a driving force behind innovations across all sectors— from healthcare and finance to entertainment and manufacturing. Its impact is far-reaching, transforming industries, reshaping economies, and influencing the way we navigate daily life.

title: Which stocks could drive the $1 trillion semiconductor milestone? Bank of America’s top bets
description: The global semiconductor industry is heading into what analysts believe could be its most powerful growth phase yet. Artificial intelligence is no longer a niche driver. It is now the core engine reshaping chip demand across data centers, cloud computing, autonomous systems, and advanced enterprise software. According to Bank of America, global semiconductor revenues are on track to cross the historic $1 trillion mark in 2026.

title: Trump Says 'I Love AI' as Boom Bets Fuel Bubble Fears
description: The stock market turned uneasy in early November as investors once again questioned whether Big Tech’s enormous investments in artificial intelligence were racing ahead of real-world results. Inside the White House, however, the turbulence appeared to draw little notice.
content:
The stock market was jittery in early November as investors again questioned whether Big Tech's massive artificial intelligence spending was outpacing reality. But inside the White House, the volatility barely seemed to matter.

title: Tech in 2025: AI went mainstream and became part of our lives, thanks to Nano Banana
description: AI didn’t just get smarter in 2025, it got closer, slipping out of tech circles and into everyday life through viral trends, photo edits, work hacks, and endless social media feeds. From Nano Banana–powered portraits to AI-polished emails and even the slop, artificial intelligence became the new normal, whether we noticed it or not.
content: Until 2025 artificial intelligence was something many people talked about but few used or experienced. This year it all changed, in ways profound and trivial. From the AI-generated Google Search snippets to that annoying AI chatbot on your favourite ... [6450 chars]

title: AI spend, corporate profits, Fed rates
description: The U.S. stock market is closing the books on a third straight year of double-digit percentage gains. A fourth stellar year in 2026 may be a tall order, requiring strong earnings, a dovish Federal Reserve and strong artificial intelligence spending.
